evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Overwhelming schedule (labs/clubs/sleep tradeoffs), lecture hall anonymity, mentor outreach anxiety, and poor nutrition habits. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: Block scheduling with recharge nights (accepted), front-row seating + prepped questions for lectures (implemented), 3-person cross-major study group (formed), concise professor email template (used), nutrition upgrades (initiated). 3) Student's response: Immediately scheduled coffee meetup, replaced snacks with salad, volunteered for first presentation slot, successfully emailed Dr. Chen. 4) Evidence of progress: Reduced isolation through study group, scheduled mentor meeting, improved nutrition tracking, proactive class participation, and visible posture relaxation per scene descriptions.

Zachary discussed 1) Overwhelm from lab/club balance causing sleep deprivation, 2) Anxiety in large lectures triggering isolation, and 3) Difficulty initiating mentor relationships. Solutions offered/accepted included: block scheduling with protected recharge time, front-row lecture positioning with prepped questions, and cross-major study groups. Zachary demonstrated progress by: immediately scheduling matcha meetup (showing solution buy-in), forming study group with Emma/Jordan, volunteering for first presentation, successfully emailing Dr. Chen using the coached template, replacing vending snacks with salad, and practicing pitches. Concrete evidence includes: photo of dining hall salad, scheduled mentor coffee, and animated study group session in post-credit scene.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Zachary discussed 1) Overwhelm from lab/club/sleep imbalance, 2) Avoidance of large lectures/dining halls, and 3) Difficulty initiating mentor relationships. Solutions offered/accepted included: block scheduling with protected downtime, front-row seating + small study groups, and structured outreach strategies (30-sec pitch, prepped questions). Zachary responded positively by immediately scheduling a coffee meetup, forming a cross-major study group, volunteering for first presentation slot, and successfully emailing Dr. Chen. Evidence of improvement includes: visibly relaxed posture post-conversation, dining hall engagement photo, secured mentor meeting, and proactive public speaking practice.

1) Problems discussed: Overwhelm from lab/club balance, lecture hall anxiety, mentor search difficulties, and dining hall avoidance. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: Block scheduling with protected recharge time, front-row lecture seating, 3-person cross-major study groups, 30-second professor pitch template, and bio lounge as low-stress alternative to dining hall. 3) Student response: Immediately implemented email template to contact Dr. Chen, volunteered for first presentation slot in Public Speaking 101, shared photo of eating in dining hall with peers, and scheduled mentor coffee. 4) Evidence of progress: Demonstrated reduced avoidance behaviors by eating in crowded dining hall, secured mentor meeting through professional outreach, and transformed academic stress into research fair presentation opportunity using creative problem-solving.
